column4: Can anyone please tell me how about increasing the maximum resolution on my screen?  I seem to be stuck with 800x600 as the max when I try and change it
oh - I thought this was a temporary thing.  I assumed once I had ubuntu up and running I could download the appropriate drivers maybe?
what video chip do you have?  lspci | grep -i vga will tell you
m1dn1ght there's a driver for it, I gotta remember
sudo apt-get install  xserver-xorg-video-sis , then log out and back in. If X is as smart as it's supposed to be now, it should recognized the driver
sounds like you have it.   do   gedit /var/log/Xorg.0.log , and copy and paste to http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
ok, it sees the sis chip but is using the vesa driver.  now show us /etc/X11/xorg.conf
no, that's a different hardware issue (probably)
do:   cd /etc/X11 && sudo cp xorg.conf xorg.conf.beforenickrudmuckedabout && sudo gedit xorg.conf   , then edit vesa to sis. Save, log out and back in
not sure then. I've never used the sis chip. Let me do a little googling
what chips set do you have again?
the chip numbers, 761/771 ? was that right?
the only thing I could find was http://gabrielstein.org/?p=201 , but your mileage may vary. I did see a gentoo post that seemed to do the same thing.
the gentoo post didn't have the link to the driver, though so I'm not sure if he used the same one
